page.title: 03General farming in Sebergham
page.content: Owner occupation of farms is be- coming more usual these days though in this area there are two farms forming part of the once vast Lowther Estates owned by the Earls of Lonsdale. The area had previously been owned by the Dukes of Devonshire. The area and climate is suited to milk production though some of the farms now run a few suckler cows and sheep are becoming more common. The only crops grown are winter fodder principally barley for cattle and root crops for sheep. Potatoes are only grown for home consumption and farm gate sales. Some of the farms on the North facing slopes of Warnell Fell are treated as summer farms and some of these are farmed in conjunction with farms on the flatter ground. They are used for summering young stock.
